DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single doses of ILV-095 in healthy Japanese male subjects.
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating Single Doses of ILV-095 in Healthy Japanese Male Subjects
DOC.criteria: Men aged 20 to 45 years inclusive at screening. Sexually active men must agree to use a medically acceptable form of contraception during the study and continue it for 12 weeks after study drug administration. Body mass index (BMI) in the range of 17.6 to 26.4 kg/m2 and body weight greater than or equal to 45 kg. Healthy as determined by the investigator on the basis of screening evaluations. Nonsmoker or smoker of fewer than 10 cigarettes per day as determined by history. Must be able to abstain from smoking during the inpatient stay. Have a high probability for compliance with and completion of the study. Presence or history of any disorder that may prevent the successful completion of the study. Any subject who had orthopedic surgery within 12 weeks of the screening visit or has planned (elective) orthopedic surgery within 12 weeks of study drug administration. Acute disease state (eg, nausea, vomiting, infection, fever, active infection, or diarrhea) within 7 days before enrollment.
